title: Rise of communist power 1941-67
creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Mel Stuart
brief_description: A survey of the events which led to the control of mainland China by Mao Tse-Tung in 1949 and the retreat of Chinag Kai-Shek to Formosa with his Nationalists. Discusses the importance of understanding Chinese current affairs and politics. Part of the series “China: century fo Revolution”.
